channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed

item.title: Bournemouth vs Liverpool Free Streams: How to watch Premier League 2025-26 from anywhere in the world
item.description: We'll show you how to watch Bournemouth vs Liverpool from anywhere in the world as Mo Salah returns to Premier League action.

item.title: Clam Ace 2 de Fresh ‘n Rebel vs CMF Headphone Pro : la bataille des casques à 99 euros
item.description: À 99 euros pile, ces deux casques Bluetooth avec ANC viennent chambouler le marché de l'entrée de gamme. Le Clam Ace 2 de Fresh 'n Rebel mise sur la couleur et le confort, le CMF Headphone Pro de Nothing sur la performance audio. Même tarif, mêmes promesses d'autonomie monstre, mais deux philosophies radicalement différentes.

item.title: Get ready for the AI ad-pocalypse
item.description: I'll confess, with no shame whatsoever, that I really love ads. Artsy ones, funny ones, weird ones, emotional ones - TV commercials were my childhood TikTok before any of us were using terms like "short-form video." But like most creative things in my life, AI is sucking the joy out of it. And it's only […]

item.title: The Telco AI factory: co-shaping the future with intelligent communications platforms
item.description: This profound evolution is driven by the Telco AI Factory, a concept being actively pioneered by hardware platform providers.

item.title: Soldes : avec 180 € en proche, faut-il craquer pour un smartphone Samsung ou Xiaomi ?
item.description: Pour celles et ceux qui veulent changer de smartphone sans se ruiner pendant les soldes, deux modèles sortent du lot : le tout nouveau Xiaomi Redmi Note 15 4G et le Samsung Galaxy A17 4G en promo à moins de 180 euros. Mais lequel des deux est le meilleur choix pour les petits budgets ?

item.title: This coming-of-age adventure game made me feel a little too seen
item.description: There's a lot about Perfect Tides: Station to Station's Mara that I find relatable. Like me, she's recently moved to a place simply called "the City" from the middle of nowhere, and like me, she's an avid writer. But these biographical details aren't the important thing; it's the way she's painted by the game's incredibly […]

item.title: 5 things to expect at Samsung Galaxy Unpacked – and 5 things we probably won’t see
item.description: The next Samsung Galaxy Unpacked is likely happening soon, and there will probably be more to it than just the Samsung Galaxy S26 series.

item.title: Wonder Man showrunner Andrew Guest reveals the 5 TV comedies that inspired the new Marvel TV show — and what he learned from them
item.description: Wonder Man's head writer discusses which popular comedy shows had a big impact on the new Disney+ show.

item.title: How to use Google Photos' new Me Meme feature
item.description: Google has started rolling out a new feature for its Photos app that can turn your images into memes. The feature, called Me Meme, uses Google Gemini to take meme templates and recreate them with the photo you use from within the app. It’s still in its experimental stages and will only be available for users in the US in the English language. In addition, it seems to be rolling out for Android users only at the moment, and Google warns that the generated images may not match the original photo at times. If you do get access to the feature soon, check out the instructions below on how to use it...
